name: Hotel Casa Thomas Somerscales

reviews.text: We felt a little disconcerted when the taxi driver in 'downtown' Valparaiso hadn't heard of the Thomas Somerscales. However, we were safely delivered and after a little confusion about our booking (the hotel's email system, they said, had been a bit erratic) we were given a lovely room on the first floor at the front of the house.
reviews.title: Tranquil setting
Beautiful house
reviews.text: The ambience at Thomas Somerscales is very restful - it's a lovely house, furnished with carefully chosen antiques, though it felt very fresh and light. The staff are incredibly helpful, though some are limited in their English skills (or, rather, we are very limited in our Spanish skills!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovely small hotel with a very friendly and helpful staff. The location is quite convenient for exploring Valparaiso. Our room was rather small but there was a large window and very well appointed bathroom. Rooms were not quite ready when we, as well as other guests, arrived from the cruise terminal. The staff brought coffee and cakes while we waited to check in.
reviews.title: Nice Place to Stay

reviews.text: Everything about this little hotel was great. The location is ideal- near lots of restaurants & shops. The house itself is so charming...right down to the wonderful employees who were so helpful and gracious to us. This was a highlight of our visit to Chile.
reviews.title: Somerscales was great!

reviews.text: The hotel is situated in Conception which is the nicest part of the city in a great building on a quiet street (although I disagree with building an extra floor in a conservation area not matter how sympathetically done)
reviews.title: A Gem..
South America refuge
reviews.text: My room was really bright and airy with period furniture coupled with a really large contemporary bathroom. The staff could not have been friendlier and the breakfasts were the best I had in the whole month I was in Chile. Really couldn't fault my stay. A fabulous bed and breakfast. I would highly recommend it.
My wife and I were spending a couple of months in Argentina, Chile and Uruguay. We were traveling alone, beginning in Buenos, and on a circle route ending back in Buenos Aires.
reviews.title: Charming hotel with great view

likes.disliked: — Moew hanging space for our clothes (3 weeks of travelling)i

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We picked up our college daughter in Santiago and came to Valpo for a family weekend. We had a lovely room tailored to our needs in this charming house in a perfect area that allows for walking and sight-seeing. If you want 5 star service and cleanliness, this is not the place for you. This is a relaxed environment with accomodating staff if you ask, but that doesn't smother you. The views from the roof are wonderful. The terrace and garden lovely for a slow morning meal and lounging about. Could the hotel improve? Yes, for example, by providing cleaner bathrooms, engaging in some deferred maintenance, and perhaps a wine hour in the evening. For all that, perhaps one would pay more. Comfort, coziness and a feeling of home away from home are the characteristics here.
reviews.title: Home away from home feeling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent one night here before leaving on a cruise. Our room was very large and nicely furnished. We found the staff very friendly and helpful. Would recommend this for people looking for something with some character. Breakfast was a treat.
reviews.title: Made our time in Valparaiso a truly unique experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights before a cruise. Arrived early in the morning and as our room was not ready they let us stay in a better room with no extra charge if we would move to our chosen room the next day. All staff were extra nice, even let us use the office internet when hotel's regular internet was down. Many of the staff spoke English.The hotel is beautiful and the breakfast served outside on the patio was outstanding - several courses. Though we had our doubts about the location when the cab stopped there, we found the area tobe very safe and were able to walk all over Valpo due to the central location.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel in every way!
Oh dear - needs an update...
reviews.text: This hotel is in a good area - handy for restaurants and walking distance to the 'ascensors'. However it's musty, antique-filled, tired and in need of a lick of paint. We booked Room 8 at the top of the house with our own terrace overlooking Valpo (amazing views) but the room's tired brown carpet, lumpy pillows, cracked bathroom mirror and flaking paint made it an expensive experience at US$200 a night. Breakfast is fine and service is friendly but there are better places to stay in the city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights at this lovely hotel and it is unique in decor and friendliness of staff. We received great recommendations on restaurants and sites to visit. The hotel is very quiet and comfortable and there is on-street parking. There is a computer for guest use and a beautiful, flower-laden porch for breakfast or relaxation. On our last day, we were unable to locate the keys to our rental car. The manager, Marcelo, was very helpful in calling Budget and trouble-shooting for us since our Spanish was definitely not up to the task; the staff here care about their guests and it shows! Five stars!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, accomodating staff,quiet location

description: The first Heritage Hotel located in Cerro Alegre in Valparaso, Hotel Boutique Casa Thomas Somerscales, is an old renovated building from 1874 that was the former house of the well known british painter Thomas Somerscales who lives twenty years in this house with his family during 1874 to 1894. Today is a small but tasteful and undoubtedly one of the most charming places to stay in Valparaso, being an excellent place to discover and witness the history and character of these unique city.
